A few main reasons. Happy to go into more detail if needed.

1. All other things equal, a charm is generally stronger than a stun given that it displaces and changes facing.
2. It generally felt like the desire for Taric to have a charm was more about personality than gameplay, and the gameplay hooks we ended up choosing for his update felt more appropriate with a stun instead of a charm.
3. It seemed like we could get most of the "charm" the character needed through emotes, VO, alternate skin fantasies, etc.

For what it's worth, we did spend a fair amount of time testing a charm on his kit. Just decided it wasn't the best fit in the end.
I'm honestly impressed that Riot actually and seriously tested a charm on Taric's kit, even though it's more of a joke than anything else.
The one we tested was actually very similar to his Live targeted Dazzle, but it charmed instead of stunned.

It's his only CC though. Why can't it be stronger than a stun?

Tahm Kench has a stun, a slow, a SUPPRESS on a BASIC ABILITY and he can make an ally untargetable and (mostly) invulnerable for about the same time as Taric, on a much shorter cooldown.

Tahm Kench is the most comparable to Taric because they are both pretty much entirely immobile (though Tahm does have Taric beat there as well). 

Additionally, Bastion is a cute ability, but every other tank support has the same thing with Bond of Stone. And yes, Taric can have both, but Taric is going to be balanced entirely around having both, so Bastion will never be that strong when combined with Bond of Stone and will generally be lackluster when Taric takes Windspeaker's instead because its numbers are tuned around being combined with Bond of Stone.

I see absolutely no argument that "A charm is stronger than a stun" is valid, especially considering that CC has a 1 second delay, which is insane. I know you said Taric's reliability profile was too much because of a point and click stun, but you made it a skill shot, you didn't increase the range, and you gave it a delay, in exchange for it being able to hit multiple targets (so a less effective, lower damage Bard Q. Joy). You also dropped the duration at early ranks, forcing him to max it first. 

Dazzle has been nerfed to the point that it is not nearly the gem it once was, and you removed all the other sources of damage from his kit except his passive, which requires him to hit his stun to use.

If it sounds like I'm angry, it's because I am, but I think all of these points are valid and I would appreciate it, Repetoir, if you didn't just skim over this comment and ignore it. Please, reply and tell me why after repeatedly nerfing this stun and giving him no other CC or mobility, you felt that "charms being stronger" wasn't a reason to give it to him? Bastion is a much weaker ability than Devour in terms of protecting your ally in lane, and Devour/Black Shield is generally better at protecting your allies from picks than Taric's new Radiance (I can't remember the full name). 

Arguing that Taric is better in team fights than either Tahm Kench or Morgana is fine, but that's because all three champions are immobile. In team fights, Leona Braum and Alistar ALL will be more effective than Taric. Hell, even Poppy or Sion will be able to peel better.

I don't want another generalist. Generalists are balanced entirely around numbers. They are either strong numerically, in which case they crowd out others, or they are weak, and then they never see play. Taric has a niche. His niche is defending his allies. You gave him subpar peeling and subpar pick protection.

> Taric has a niche. His niche is defending his allies. You gave him subpar peeling and subpar pick protection.

As a sort of paladin archtype, I wanted to make Taric focused on defending his allies in less of a strict "I peel for you" way (like how most tanks express their ability to defend) and more in an "I empower you" way, which is why his defending is focused more on shield, healing, etc.

I agree that Taric does have subpar peeling and pick protection next to many other tanks/supports. That said, his ability to defend a team in a teamfight scenario is pretty unparalleled, which is a tradeoff I believe is appropriate.

I agree. I think it paid off, and I like the way it looks a lot. Still can't wait to play it myself; I bought Taric with ip as my first champ because I wanted to play that fantasy of a supportive paladin, and I only moved to playing other champs because I didn't feel like Taric delivered on it as well as I wanted.

This rework looks to me like it will fix that, and I'm amped.

The only good thing about him now (and {{champion:1}} fits the bill too imo) is their access to RELIABLE hard CC. While a lot of other CC are way more rewarding if landed (Blitz hook/Morgana snare/Thresh hook), they are all skillshots and can be dodged no matter how skilled the Thresh/Blitz/Morg is because it also relies on the enemy's skill at dodging, not just the cc-bot's aim.

The reason you would pick Taric/Annie in your comp vs all other cc bots is when you need a CC that is guaranteed whenever you need it, especially for the champs these days that fly all over the map with their dashes (and screw your skillshots up). With regards to your comment, they did actually remove the only good thing about him before when they made the stun a skillshot. It's definitely more impactful if landed properly now, but that's a core change to him since it's a tradeoff for his old reliability.

Now Annie is the only champ in the game with a point and click stun available pre-6. I have a feeling that's going to disappear soon, with the way rate point and click cc are being removed.
